column1: Anthedon@Will I keep my eye on the horizon for pirate vessels if I choose to trek to Anthedon?@Illyrians and Aitolians alike may prey on you in Anthedon's port.
Doris@Will I keep my eye on the horizon for pirate vessels if I choose to trek to Anthedon?@You will if you wish to live! Scoundrelly Illyrians who take pride in their piracy
column3: and the Etruscans who swoop in from western shores

column1: Euboia@Must my crew keep arms at the ready as we cruise along its banks?@You will if you hope to survive! Many pirates know its coves: Illyrians who follow Queen Teuta
column4: and Aetolians who'll sack a sanctuary to pluck out a gold statue or two!

column1: Histiaia/Oreos@Do the people of Histiaia have reason to fear when they put to sea - do pirates lurk along their coasts?@Alas indeed! They tremble for the Aetolian pirates
column2: as well as Illyrian: both types as greedy as they are fearless! Homer sang of this ferocity: 'Even as a leopard goes forth from a deep thicket in full view of a hunter and he is not afraid
column3: He does not flee when he hears the baying of the hounds.'%(Iliad 21: 568-570)

column1: Iolcus@What of pirates in my homeland?@Indeed! Iolcus is beset by Illyrians and Aetolians alike: Ferocious pirates
column2: they will be the end of you! The eels and the fishes will finish you off
column3: dining on the fat from your kidneys while the dark water laps about you.%(adapted from Iliad 21: 201-205)

column1: Kerinthos@Will pirates lurk around the bend as we draw close to this town?@Illyrians
column2: Cretans and Aetolians alike hover to challenge you
column3: and grow rich from your stores! They will fall upon you and you will strive to escape: as when
column4: beneath the surge of a fire
column5: locusts take wing to flee to a river as the relentless fire sears them with its sudden oncoming
column6: and they shrink down beneath the water.%(Iliad 21: 12-15)

column1: Kerinthos@Will pirates lurk around the bend as we draw close to this town?@Indeed - Cretans famous for lying
column4: famous for love of piratical craft! You will cower before them 'as when fish flee before a voracious dolphin and fill the crannies of a harbor with good anchorage in their terror
column5: for the dolphin greedily devours every one he can'!%(Iliad 21: 23-25)

column1: Larissa (Thessaly)@Do pirates pester so well-connected a town?@Only the Aitiolians: some claim that the Larissan's formal friendship with Aitolia was driven by the desire to buy themselves freedom from predation!

Pagasae@Must I fear pirates in these waters
column2: and keep an eye on my crew
column4: my life?@Only if you are wise! The port from which you first set sail is on the itinerary as well for pirates from Aetolia and Illyria: how unfortunate it never chose to become the friends of the Aetolians!  Such pirates are mighty in battle: they will cast you to the fishes
column5: to lick the blood from your wounds! Nor will your mothers get to mourn you

column1: Pelion@Do pirates lurk in this region?@Indeed
column2: even in the shadow of the mountain of centaurs! It seems the memory of the centaurs infuses the people who sail its coasts: pirates of Crete and Aetolia

column6: Your dark blood will flow from your neck and wet the ground'!%(adapted from Iliad 21: 116-121)

column4: the Aetolians who fear no man and love all gain - they will embrace you at your coming
column5: undo the strings of your purse
column6: and leave your men shaking in their rowing benches! Prepare for a fight if you draw into those waters!
